page.title: 13Transport.
page.content: Our area is very hilly, and this makes travelling difficult, especially in winter. The school bus fails to collect pupils off the top of Long Mountain during bad weather because of the very steep bank. Years ago children walked miles to and from school. Our parents remind us of that awful day when the school bus crashed into the orchard near the Post Office as it careered down the bank out of control. It was a miracle no-one was killed. That was in 1952. Along the very top of Long Mountain there is a Roman road. The drovers used this route regularly to get their cattle to the big markets in England. They often used mountain routes to avoid paying tolls at the toll-gates on main roads. The old inn, the Welsh Harp, where the drovers rested overnight can still be seen.
